intro: Eupatorium beneolens f. ctenotum, commonly known as the hairy false dragonhead, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
